definition: بار (بور) bāra u (baur, بوار bawār) to perish; to lie fallow, be uncultivated (land); to be futile, unsuccessful, unprofitable, lead to nothing (work); to be unsalable, be dead stock (merchandise)│بارت البنات (bint) the girl could not get a husband II to let lie fallow (هـ land); to make unprofitable, useless (هـ s.th.) IV to destroy بور būr uncultivated, fallow│ ارض بور (arḍ), pl. اراض بور (arāḍin) fallow land, wasteland
